sen.j: 蔦屋 重三郎（つたや じゅうざぶろう、寛延3年1月7日 (旧暦)（1750年2月13日） - 寛政9年5月6日 (旧暦)（1797年5月31日））は江戸時代の版元（出版人）である。
sen.e: Juzaburo TSUTAYA (February 13, 1750- May, 31, 1797) is a "hanmoto" (publisher) in Edo period.

sen.e: Juzaburo TSUTAYA (February 13, 1750 - May 31, 1797) is a "hanmoto" (publisher) in the Edo period.

sen.j: 朋誠堂喜三二、山東京伝らの黄表紙・洒落本、喜多川歌麿や東洲斎写楽の浮世絵などの出版で知られる。
sen.e: He was known for publishing "kibyoshi" (illustrated books of popular fictions whose covers are yellow) and "sharebon" (gay-quarter novelettes) by Kisanji HOSEIDO, Kyoden SANTO and so on, and "ukiyoe" (Japanese woodblock prints) by Utamaro KITAGAWA and Sharaku TOSHUSAI.

sen.j: 父（丸山氏）は江戸の吉原 (東京都)で遊廓の勤め人だったという。
sen.e: His father (Maruyama clan) was said to have worked at "yukaku" (a red-light district) in Yoshiwara, Edo (Tokyo).

sen.j: 寛延3年（1750年）、重三郎も吉原に生まれ、のちに喜多川氏の養子になった。
sen.e: In 1750, Juzaburo was born in Yoshiwara and later adopted by Kitagawa clan.

sen.j: 「蔦屋」は喜多川氏の屋号であり、吉原の茶屋といわれる。
sen.e: Tsutaya' is a name of the store of Kitagawa clan and it was said to have been a "chaya" (tea house) in Yoshiwara.

sen.j: 安永2年（1773年）、重三郎は吉原大門の前に書店を開き、はじめは吉原細見（店ごとに遊女の名を記した案内書）の販売、出版から出版業に関わっていった。
sen.e: In 1773, Juzaburo opened a book store in front of "Yoshiwara Omon" (a main gate to Yoshiwara), and first sold and published "Yoshiwara Saiken" (Yoshiwara Guidebook which indicates the names of prostitutes of each shops) and started to involve in publishing business.

sen.j: 安永9年（1780年）に売れっ子作家・朋誠堂喜三二の黄表紙を出版したのを手始めに本格的に出版業を拡大。
sen.e: In 1780, he published a kibyoshi by a popular writer, Kisanji HOSEIDO as a start, and then fully expanded his publishing business.

sen.j: これ以後、洒落本や狂歌本などのヒット作を次々に刊行し、天明3年（1783年）に一流版元の並ぶ日本橋に進出。
sen.e: Since then, he published successful sharebon and "kyokabon" (book of humorous poems) consecutively, and in 1783, he moved to Nihonbashi, a district which was lined with prestigious hanmoto.

sen.j: 浮世絵では歌麿の名作を世に送った。

sen.e: But the control of the morals became strict due to Kansei Reform, and in 1791, Sharebon and kibyoshi by Kyoden SANTO were charged.

sen.e: Juzaburo was fined, and Kyoden received "tegusari" penalty (confinement to one's residence and restraint in behavior with handcuffs on the wrists) for 50 days.
